result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen K Lyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Do not care for minor children unless approved by DOC.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Conditions are as outlined in Count 1.
Conditions are as outlined in Count 1.

Defendant Kathleen K Lyman in court with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
State calls Dr. Rita Kadamian - DSAT. Direct by the State. The State marks Ex #1-CV of Dr. Kadamian. State moves Ex #1 into evidence/received.  Defense is not disputing that the witness is an expert but they do not agree that the subject of her testimony would meet the Daubert standards. Cross xam by defense. BTC: The state is not to introduce whether the bit marks were made by an adult or a child. State has nothing further regarding Dr. Kadamian. State calls Inv. Jody Spiegelhoff - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by defense. No further exhibits or witnesses. Parties give argument.

BTC: Written decision to be rendered. FPT/JT to be set  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
